fgeo: Analyze forest diversity and dynamics

output: github_document

fgeo installs and loads multiple R packages and functions in a single step.

Packages

package title
———————————————————————— ———————————————— bciex Forest Dynamics Data from Barro Colorado Island fgeo Easily Install and Load Packages of ForestGEO
fgeo.abundance R packages for the Analysis of Forest Dynamics
fgeo.demography Demography Tools
fgeo.habitat Habitat Analyses
fgeo.map Map ForestGEO’s Data
fgeo.tool Utility Tools for ForestGEO Packages

Search all functions, and datasets

Installation

# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("forestgeo/fgeo")

To learn the details about how to install packages from GitHub, read this blog post.

Example

Load all fgeo packages in one step.

library(fgeo)

Update packages that changed since last installation.

fgeo_update()

Table packages.

fgeo_index_packages()
#>           package                                           Title
#> 1           bciex Forest Dynamics Data from Barro Colorado Island
#> 2            fgeo   Easily Install and Load Packages of ForestGEO
#> 3  fgeo.abundance  R packages for the Analysis of Forest Dynamics
#> 4 fgeo.demography                                Demography Tools
#> 5    fgeo.habitat                                Habitat Analyses
#> 6        fgeo.map                            Map ForestGEO's Data
#> 7       fgeo.tool            Utility Tools for ForestGEO Packages

Table and explore functions.

library(dplyr)
funs <- fgeo_index_functions()
sample_n(funs, 10)
#>             package                  fun
#> 96        fgeo.tool    row_filter_status
#> 63        fgeo.tool             add_quad
#> 102       fgeo.tool          to_recensus
#> 7              fgeo fgeo_index_functions
#> 15   fgeo.abundance           basal_area
#> 75        fgeo.tool   fieldforms_prepare
#> 6              fgeo  fgeo_index_datasets
#> 78        fgeo.tool            ls_csv_df
#> 74        fgeo.tool    fieldforms_output
#> 31  fgeo.demography       recruitment_df
